subject: Allow "static symlinks"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-01-25 01:14:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/10e102995a67d263e6747b849e819490cbe07cc6', 'message': 'Allow "harder" symlinks

... by embedding some `If-Match: <etag>` semantics in the symlink.

When creating a symlink, users may now specify an optional
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header. If present, the etag of the final object
returned to the client will be checked; if it does not match the
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header, a 412 Precondition Failed error will be
returned to the client. If multiple symlinks are chained together, each
symlink must either use the same X-Symlink-Target-Etag or omit the
header.

Note that, similar to other symlink behavior, no validation is done at
PUT time, only during GET.

Bonus goodness:

- Tighten assertions on Content-Location
- Get rid of source.source-sniffing by making versioned_writes
  symlink-aware ('cause I'm going to want to make it symlink-aware
  later anyway)
- Allow middlewares left of symlink set their own
  Container-Update-Override-Etag when creating a symlink

Change-Id: I179ea6180d31146bb947061c69b1807c59529ac8
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-01-25 21:25:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/c831e51342870b3b884edc7765e858b4dee12844', 'message': 'Allow "harder" symlinks

... by embedding some `If-Match: <etag>` semantics in the symlink.

When creating a symlink, users may now specify an optional
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header. If present, the etag of the final object
returned to the client will be checked; if it does not match the
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header, a 412 Precondition Failed error will be
returned to the client. If multiple symlinks are chained together, each
symlink must either use the same X-Symlink-Target-Etag or omit the
header.

Note that, similar to other symlink behavior, no validation is done at
PUT time, only during GET.

Bonus goodness:

- Tighten assertions on Content-Location
- Get rid of source.source-sniffing by making versioned_writes
  symlink-aware ('cause I'm going to want to make it symlink-aware
  later anyway)
- Allow middlewares left of symlink set their own
  Container-Update-Override-Etag when creating a symlink

Change-Id: I179ea6180d31146bb947061c69b1807c59529ac8
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-01-31 23:48:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/8c2cbe5044ed7f4776c46002c2ff3a3a1d228a25', 'message': 'Allow "harder" symlinks

... by embedding something like `If-Match: <etag>` semantics in the
symlink.

When creating a symlink, users may now specify an optional
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header. If present, the etag of the final object
returned to the client will be checked; if it does not match the
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header, a 409 Conflict error will be returned to
the client. If multiple symlinks are chained together, each symlink must
either use the same X-Symlink-Target-Etag or omit the header.

Note that, similar to other symlink behavior, no validation is done at
PUT time, only during GET.

Bonus goodness:

- Tighten assertions on Content-Location
- Get rid of swift.source-sniffing by making versioned_writes
  symlink-aware ('cause I'm going to want to make it symlink-aware
  later anyway)
- Allow middlewares left of symlink to set their own
  Container-Update-Override-Etag when creating a symlink

Change-Id: I179ea6180d31146bb947061c69b1807c59529ac8

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2019-03-25 21:34:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/573ad41a9eadae9480b4a0405b92e6d031a8ced9', 'message': 'Allow "harder" symlinks

... by embedding something like `If-Match: <etag>` semantics in the
symlink.

When creating a symlink, users may now specify an optional
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header. If present, the etag of the final object
returned to the client will be checked; if it does not match the
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header, a 409 Conflict error will be returned to
the client. If multiple symlinks are chained together, each symlink must
either use the same X-Symlink-Target-Etag or omit the header.

Note that, unlink "softer" symlink behavior, the target object must
exist with the matching Etag for the "hardlink" to be created.

Since we're validating the Etag anyway, we also force the content-type
to match and send the content-length along to the container listing as
well.

Bonus goodness:

- Tighten assertions on Content-Location
- Get rid of swift.source-sniffing by making versioned_writes
  symlink-aware ('cause I'm going to want to make it symlink-aware
  later anyway)
- Allow middlewares left of symlink to set their own
  Container-Update-Override-Etag when creating a symlink

Change-Id: I179ea6180d31146bb947061c69b1807c59529ac8

X-Symlink-Target-Etag header. If present, the etag of the final object
returned to the client will be checked; if it does not match the
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header, a 409 Conflict error will be returned to
the client.

the etag & content-length along to the container listing as well.

commit_message:
Allow "static symlinks"

... by embedding something like `If-Match: <etag>` semantics in the
symlink.

When creating a symlink, users may now specify an optional
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header. If present, the etag of the final object
returned to the client will be checked; if it does not match the
X-Symlink-Target-Etag header, a 409 Conflict error will be returned to
the client.

Note that, unlike "dynamic symlink" behavior, the target object must
exist with the matching Etag for the "static symlink" to be created.

Since we're validating the Etag anyway, we also set the content-type of
the symlink to match if the client didn't otherwise specifiy and send
the etag & content-length along to the container listing as well.

Bonus goodness:

- Tighten assertions on Content-Location
- Get rid of swift.source-sniffing by making versioned_writes
  symlink-aware ('cause I'm going to want to make it symlink-aware
  later anyway)
- Allow middlewares left of symlink to set their own
  Container-Update-Override-Etag when creating a symlink
- Set dynamic symlink content type if client doesn't supply something

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I179ea6180d31146bb947061c69b1807c59529ac8

commit_message:
Add retry for DBDeadlock in credential delete

Adds oslo.db retry wrapper to delete_credential_for_user method.

Change-Id: Ib9e161411f0985785eec46c51d721ef7421ee090
Closes-Bug: #1840291
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/33/676733/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock from oslo_db import exception as oslo_db_exception def test_delete_credential_retries_on_deadlock(self): patcher = mock.patch('sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.delete', autospec=True) class FakeDeadlock(object): def __init__(self, mock_patcher): self.deadlock_count = 2 self.mock_patcher = mock_patcher self.patched = True def __call__(self, *args, **kwargs): if self.deadlock_count > 1: self.deadlock_count -= 1 else: self.mock_patcher.stop() self.patched = False raise oslo_db_exception.DBDeadlock sql_delete_mock = patcher.start() side_effect = FakeDeadlock(patcher) sql_delete_mock.side_effect = side_effect try: PROVIDERS.credential_api.delete_credentials_for_user( user_id=self.user['id']) finally: if side_effect.patched: patcher.stop() # initial attempt + 1 retry self.assertEqual(sql_delete_mock.call_count, 2)

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

Held back the following

lxml===4.4.1        nova tests fail https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1838666
websockify===0.9.0  tempest test failing, ping nova
tornado===5.1.1     salt is cauing this, no eta on fix (same as the last year)
stestr===2.5.0      needs merged https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/pull/265
jsonschema===3.0.2  see https://review.opendev.org/649789
oauthlib===3.1.0    keystone https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1839393
kubernetes===10.0.1 openshift PINS this, only kuryr-tempest-plugin deps on it
tenacity===5.1.1    failing tests in neutron

Change-Id: I79baeee85f93adb2adfd01b1f02ca511073c8d78

commit_message:
Add retry for sync_point_update_input_data

update_input_data in sync_point.sync() at times fails with
DBDeadlock. Let's add retry like sync_point_create()

Change-Id: Id4468801bcffa7a704d90d2e190ec8dbb9a0a00b
Task: 36299
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/48/677048/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=3, retry_on_deadlock=True, retry_interval=0.5, inc_retry_interval=True)

subject: Track usage info on RequestWideSearchContext
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-05 12:00:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/79f0ffc7c4fafd605239d19dee6e297873f03fbf', 'message': "Track usage info on RequestWideSearchContext

We were building usage information for each RequestGroup. This
could often involve looking up usage information for duplicated
providers.

Now, track the seen root ids on the RequestWideSearchContext in
a set, and extend a list of usages (on that object) only by those
root ids that we haven't yet seen.

In the process move _get_usages_by_provider_tree to

commit_message:
Track usage info on RequestWideSearchContext

We were building usage information for each RequestGroup. This
could often involve looking up usage information for duplicated
providers.

Now, track the seen root ids on the RequestWideSearchContext in
a set, and extend a list of usages (on that object) only by those
root ids that we haven't yet seen.

In the process move _get_usages_by_provider_tree to
RequestWideSearchContext and rename it to
extend_usages_by_provider_tree

Manual testing indicates that after the first call to extend... we
can frequently skip it entirely.

Change-Id: I5d05d15d33beb1622a06bde0e32c3f52ba01b448
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/81/674581/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Update rw_ctx.usages summaries for each provider in the trees rw_ctx.extend_usages_by_provider_tree(root_ids) _build_provider_summaries(rg_ctx.context, rw_ctx, prov_traits) # Update rw_ctx.usages summaries for each provider rw_ctx.extend_usages_by_provider_tree(root_ids) _build_provider_summaries(rg_ctx.context, rw_ctx, prov_traits)def _build_provider_summaries(context, rw_ctx, prov_traits): for usage in rw_ctx.usages:
deleted_lines: import sqlalchemy as sa from sqlalchemy import sql # Grab usage summaries for each provider in the trees usages = _get_usages_by_provider_tree(rg_ctx.context, root_ids) _build_provider_summaries(rg_ctx.context, rw_ctx, usages, prov_traits) # Grab usage summaries for each provider usages = _get_usages_by_provider_tree(rg_ctx.context, root_ids) _build_provider_summaries(rg_ctx.context, rw_ctx, usages, prov_traits)def _build_provider_summaries(context, rw_ctx, usages, prov_traits): for usage in usages:@db_api.placement_context_manager.reader def _get_usages_by_provider_tree(ctx, root_ids): """Returns a row iterator of usage records grouped by provider ID for all resource providers in all trees indicated in the ``root_ids``. """ # We build up a SQL expression that looks like this: # SELECT # rp.id as resource_provider_id # , rp.uuid as resource_provider_uuid # , inv.resource_class_id # , inv.total # , inv.reserved # , inv.allocation_ratio # , inv.max_unit # , usage.used # FROM resource_providers AS rp # LEFT JOIN inventories AS inv # ON rp.id = inv.resource_provider_id # LEFT JOIN ( # SELECT resource_provider_id, resource_class_id, SUM(used) as used # FROM allocations # JOIN resource_providers # ON allocations.resource_provider_id = resource_providers.id # AND (resource_providers.root_provider_id IN($root_ids) # OR resource_providers.id IN($root_ids)) # GROUP BY resource_provider_id, resource_class_id # ) # AS usage # ON inv.resource_provider_id = usage.resource_provider_id # AND inv.resource_class_id = usage.resource_class_id # WHERE rp.root_provider_id IN ($root_ids) rpt = sa.alias(_RP_TBL, name="rp") inv = sa.alias(_INV_TBL, name="inv") # Build our derived table (subquery in the FROM clause) that sums used # amounts for resource provider and resource class derived_alloc_to_rp = sa.join( _ALLOC_TBL, _RP_TBL, sa.and_(_ALLOC_TBL.c.resource_provider_id == _RP_TBL.c.id, _RP_TBL.c.root_provider_id.in_(root_ids)) ) usage = sa.alias( sa.select([ _ALLOC_TBL.c.resource_provider_id, _ALLOC_TBL.c.resource_class_id, sql.func.sum(_ALLOC_TBL.c.used).label('used'), ]).select_from(derived_alloc_to_rp).group_by( _ALLOC_TBL.c.resource_provider_id, _ALLOC_TBL.c.resource_class_id ), name='usage') # Build a join between the resource providers and inventories table rpt_inv_join = sa.outerjoin(rpt, inv, rpt.c.id == inv.c.resource_provider_id) # And then join to the derived table of usages usage_join = sa.outerjoin( rpt_inv_join, usage, sa.and_( usage.c.resource_provider_id == inv.c.resource_provider_id, usage.c.resource_class_id == inv.c.resource_class_id, ), ) query = sa.select([ rpt.c.id.label("resource_provider_id"), rpt.c.uuid.label("resource_provider_uuid"), inv.c.resource_class_id, inv.c.total, inv.c.reserved, inv.c.allocation_ratio, inv.c.max_unit, usage.c.used, ]).select_from(usage_join).where( rpt.c.root_provider_id.in_(root_ids) ) return ctx.session.execute(query).fetchall()

commit_message:
Fix promote api-ref jobs

These jobs fail currently with:
ERROR! the role 'set-service-type-data-fact' was not found ...

Add role-path so that they can be found.

Change-Id: I3d5eefc91bb71c7dc659154a920bff72c5b820be

commit_message:
Revert "Updated from Puppet OpenStack modules constraints"

This is breaking tripleo CI https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1840641
Also pin it in external_modules so it does not get reproposed by bots

This reverts commit 1bc0fe89242cf4620578d07e90afd1fa193a7ec4.

Change-Id: Ieffeafb6b9a1e3f3bbfcb327a8e5ec0ac3b194b1

add two lines everytime it's run.

commit_message:
Add basic minion validation

The minion doesn't actually have any api services so we validate it by
checking the service status on the undercloud. This change adds a role
to validate the heat engine and ironic conductor status on the
undercloud includes additional hosts (undercloud + minion) and there are
no failed services.

Change-Id: I41859f93980dd8cd723ea4ad0f4e6592a78d0082
Related-Blueprint: undercloud-minion

commit_message:
[Queens] Enable container auth support

In queens we didn't use the ansible-role-container-registry so we need
to port the ansible logic that we use into puppet for the docker
service configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1833584
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670082/
Change-Id: I5ee8f8b17ad3424a3bf9d4a420d6c65ab977c6b7

Setting this to true will cause login calls to be performed during the deployment. ContainerImageRegistryCredentials: type: json hidden: true default: {} description: | Mapping of image registry hosts to login credentials. commit_message:
[queens only] Add registry login support

Queens uses puppet to configure docker so we need to add support for
logging into the registry in the puppet class itself.

Change-Id: I8ca84798ba0e89cee9674dbe414de892d5d9e3f1
Related-Bug: #1833584

subject: Ceph-RGW HAProxy config skipped when shouldnt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-19 09:14:04.000000000', 'files': ['inventory/group_vars/haproxy/haproxy.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/b59f688673d929e37cb6390d42affa466f663ee8', 'message': "Ceph-RGW HAProxy config skipped when shouldnt

Now that group ceph-rgw is in the default inventory (commit c700fdba)
the logic for haproxy_backend_nodes would always select the group
'ceph-rgw' as it will always be defined, regardless of length.

If using the ceph_rgws variable instead of the ceph-rgws group it
meant that the haproxy_backend_nodes equated to an empty group.
So the 'when' criteria in haproxy_service_config.yml did not get met
and the services config was not provisioned.

This fix checks the length of the ceph-rgws group.
If its not greater than zero, haproxy_backend_nodes is defaulted
back to ceph_rgws.

Change-Id: I7ac3e3ba9e64b38ec22704394fcd5f402dd9d7f8
(cherry picked from commit 00417b6856a4dd6363e85df95af67202d95c1529)
"}]
commit_message:
Ceph-RGW HAProxy config skipped when shouldnt

Now that group ceph-rgw is in the default inventory (commit c700fdba)
the logic for haproxy_backend_nodes would always select the group
'ceph-rgw' as it will always be defined, regardless of length.

If using the ceph_rgws variable instead of the ceph-rgws group it
meant that the haproxy_backend_nodes equated to an empty group.
So the 'when' criteria in haproxy_service_config.yml did not get met
and the services config was not provisioned.

This fix checks the length of the ceph-rgws group.
If its not greater than zero, haproxy_backend_nodes is defaulted
back to ceph_rgws.

Change-Id: I7ac3e3ba9e64b38ec22704394fcd5f402dd9d7f8
(cherry picked from commit 00417b6856a4dd6363e85df95af67202d95c1529)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/53/677153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: haproxy_backend_nodes: "{{ (groups['ceph-rgw'] is defined and groups['ceph-rgw'] | length > 0) | ternary(groups['ceph-rgw'], ceph_rgws) }}"

Rename review.openstack.org to review.opendev.org

There are many references to review.openstack.org, and while the
redirect should work, we can also go ahead and fix them.

commit_message:
VNF packages support for VNF onboarding

This specification describes changes needed to be implemented to support
onboarding and instantiation of VNFs described as VNF Package.

Co-authored-By: Hiroyuki Jo <hiroyuki.jo.mt@hco.ntt.co.jp>
Co-authored-By: Tushar Patil <tushar.vitthal.patil@gmail.com>
Blueprint: tosca-csar-mgmt-driver
Change-Id: Icbc6afa192b50b3fe6640207863ada9bac7c1fda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/30/582930/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================ Support TOSCA CSAR in Tacker ============================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/tosca-csar-mgmt-driver This spec describes the plan to implement the functionality for onboarding CSAR VNF packages in Tacker [1]. Problem description =================== Currently in Tacker there is already implemented the functionality of onboarding of YAML VNF descriptors. But Cloud Service Archive is not supported, in spite of the fact, that it is possible to select CSAR file in Tacker Horizon for onboarding and CSAR is supported in TOSCA parser. The Cloud Service Archive CSAR is a package defined by OASIS TOSCA. It is a container file using the ZIP file format. Besides the service template of a cloud application it includes all artifacts required to manage the lifecycle of the corresponding cloud application (i.e. the implementation artifacts of the operations of the node types) as well as all artifacts to execute the cloud application (i.e. the deployment artifacts of the node types like virtual images, SQL DDL etc). In order to support in a certain environment the execution and management of the lifecycle of a cloud application all corresponding artifacts must be available in that environment. This means that beside the service definition of the cloud application the deployment artifacts and implementation artifacts must be available in that environment. To ease the task of ensuring the availability of all these, this specification defines a corresponding archive format called CSAR (Cloud Service ARchive). CSAR allows to specify: * Metadata providing an entry information for processing a CSAR file * The manifest file is the key for decision regarding a VNF package integrity and validity in terms of its contained artifacts. * The VNF licensing information located in a directory named "Licenses" * The VNF package change history file named "ChangeLog.txt" * VNF package testing files for VNF package validation * If the manifest file is signed by the VNF provider, the CSAR VNF package shall contain a certificate file * Types definitions for topology template * Topology template * Configuration artifacts * Monitoring configurations CSAR packages are essential for modern multicomponent VNFs and NS with a lot of artifacts, security sensitive data, complex topology of the service. The lack of support of CSAR packages makes Tacker incompatible with most modern VNFs & NSs. The goal here is to implement the necessary functionality in the Tacker server and the Tacker client side so the user has the capability to onboard & instantiate CSAR archives. Proposed change =============== The high-level changes needed to Tacker in order to accommodate this new feature will include changes to Tacker Client and Server. Changes include: * Implement 2-stage onboading of CSAR VNFD in Tacker Server: 1. Create VNFD and store it in database. Modification of create_vnfd method in VNFM Plugin of Tacker Server - add ability to create VNFD for CSAR package and persist data in database. New status - "onboarding" for 1 stage. 2. Upload CSAR and unzip it into filesystem, update VNFD information in database. Implementation of new method upload_vnfd for getting CSAR, unzipping to the filesystem, validations via TOSCA parser library, updating VNFD catalog database. Store Entry-Definitions YAML as VNFD attribute with key "vnfd". Content of this YAML (main template and definitions) will be displayed in Horizon as CSAR content. * Modify VNFD delete method in Tacker Server side: delete data in file structure. * Necessary modifications in Tacker Client: add validation of VNFD source (YAML or CSAR) and mapping to calls of mentioned above server methods. +------------+ +--------------+ +---------------+ | | | | | | | CSAR | | | | Tacker | | package +---------> Horizon +---------> Client | | | | | | | +------------+ +--------------+ +---+------+----+ | | +--------------------------------+ | | | Tacker | | | | +-----------+ | POST /v1.0 /vnfds| | | | <----------------|------------------+ | + | | REST | | | | | Conroller | | PATCH /v1.0/vnfds/uuid | | | <----------------|-------------------------+ | ++--+-------+ | | | | | | | | | +----------------------+ | | | +--------------------+ | | Libraries | | | | | VNFM Plugin | | | +--------------+ | | | | | +----------------+ | | | | TOSCA | | | | +---> create_vnfd | +-------------> PARCER | | | | | +----------------+ | | | +--------------+ | | | | | | | | | | | +----------------+ | | | +--------------+ | | +------> upload_vnfd | +-------------> HEAT | | | | +----------------+ | | | | TRANSLATOR | | | +--------------------+ | | +--------------+ | +--------------------------------+ +----------------------+ Data model Impact ================= +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | VNFD Catalog Tacker Database | |-----------------------------------------------------------| | | | +-----------------+ | | +-----------------+ | servicetypes | | | | vnfd | |-----------------| | | |-----------------| | id | | | | id +----+----> vnfd_id | | | | tenant_id | | | tenant_id | | | | name | | | service_type | | | | description | | +-----------------+ | | | mgmt_driver | | | | | created_at | | +-----------------+ | | | updated_at | | | vnfd_attribute | | | | deleted_at | | |-----------------| | | | template_source | | | id | | | +-----------------+ +----> vnfd_id | | | | | key | | | | | value | | | | +-----------------+ | | | | +-----------------------------------------------------------+ | | | +---------------------------+ | | VNFD catalog file storage | | |---------------------------| | | | +----> /var/lib/tacker/<uuid>/ | | ----TOSCA-Metadata | | ----definitions | | ----implementations | | ---- ... | +---------------------------+ References ========== - [1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/tosca/TOSCA/v1.0/os/TOSCA-v1.0-os.html#_Toc356403711 - [2] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/004/02.03.01_60/gs_nfv-sol004v020301p.pdf

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 09:13:32.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ceph/ceph-osd/extend_start.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/64c1acd32537b0746f9f6ada2b9f63a676990ecc', 'message': 'Add partition detection to fix osd initialization failure

https://review.opendev.org/652612

commit_message:
Add partition detection to fix osd initialization failure

The changes in the following commit did not completely solve the
problem of osd initialization failure:
https://review.opendev.org/652612

In order to solve this problem, the partprobe command consistent with
ceph-disk is added, and then a loop is added to detect the partition,
which is acquired every 1s. When the partition appears, the osd
initialization is continued.

Change-Id: I0ca255c6358132d9e3acfa6b610b70a78756512c
Closes-bug: #1824787
(cherry picked from commit 342c9f0cd0dc4b97870dc40fab6c5a7d241b40ed)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/57/676657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Inform the os about partition table changes function partprobe_device { local device=$1 udevadm settle --timeout=600 flock -s ${device} partprobe ${device} udevadm settle --timeout=600 } # In some cases, the disk partition will not appear immediately, so check every # 1s, try up to 10 times. In general, this interval is enough. function wait_partition_appear { local dev_part=$1 local part_name=$(echo ${dev_part} | awk -F '/' '{print $NF}') for(( i=1; i<11; i++ )); do flag=$(ls /dev | awk '/'"${part_name}"'/{print $0}' | wc -l) if [[ "${flag}" -eq 0 ]]; then echo "sleep 1 waits for the partition ${dev_part} to appear: ${i}" sleep 1 else return 0 fi done echo "The device /dev/${dev_part} does not appear within the limited time 10s." exit 1 } partprobe_device "${OSD_BS_DEV}" wait_partition_appear "${OSD_BS_DEV}"p2 wait_partition_appear "${OSD_BS_DEV}"2

commit_message:
Fix zun start in devstack IPV6

check the SERVICE_HOST definition in ipv6:
SERVICE_HOST=${SERVICE_HOST:-[$HOST_IPV6]}
this will not the  IPv4 or IPv6 address,
will cause zun start failed check log here [0].

[0]: https://storage.gra1.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/logs_51/677051/2/check/solum-tempest-ipv6-only/564d1fa/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

Change-Id: I4b40b48ff69d55cee3bfd783d6a4c4862661b160
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/58/677058/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $SERVICE_IP_VERSION == 6 ]]; then iniset $ZUN_CONF api host_ip "$HOST_IPV6" else iniset $ZUN_CONF api host_ip "$HOST_IP" fi

commit_message:
Dissuade .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools. Add a comment block explaining this, for
clarity, and remove the one current editor-specific entry present.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks, documentation
and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of Ib58a57267b064e4142686de6c37a70dbff04b9a7
from the openstack-dev/cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: I9b46f30550f1149c039510dfe17228eb177d8190
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/29/609229/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add patterns in here to exclude files created by tools integrated with this # repository, such as test frameworks from the project's recommended workflow, # rendered documentation and package builds. # # Don't add patterns to exclude files created by preferred personal tools # (editors, IDEs, your operating system itself even). These should instead be # maintained outside the repository, for example in a ~/.gitignore file added # with: # # git config --global core.excludesfile '~/.gitignore'

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: Ica2956fb606f4721d837ec77f24a52cfd1e3398d

subject: iLO firmware update fails with 'update_firmware_sum' clean step
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-05 13:51:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/management.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_management.py', 'releasenotes/notes/story-2006223-ilo-hpsum-firmware-update-fails-622883e4785313c1.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/3f2b81e9d5f81a6a5da2e16e65e8cc8eeca786e1', 'message': "iLO firmware update fails with 'update_firmware_sum' clean step

Firmware update using 'update_firmware_sum' clean step fails with
an error stating that unable to connect to iLO address due to
authentication failure.
The 'update_firmware_sum' is an inband clean step wherein the
firmware ISO was inserted from IPA ramdisk. As part of security
fix to ironic the BMC credentials are no more passed to the IPA
ramdisk. The attempt to connect to iLO from IPA ramdisk fails.
The fix has been made to insert the firmware ISO from the
conductor.

Change-Id: I866330c5fc98b1c5bc042c296c3b6e76ed9fd57d
Story: 2006223
Task: 35821
(cherry picked from commit 50bfd9067fdeebcc89117ddab4fdd1573dba565e)
"}]
commit_message:
iLO firmware update fails with 'update_firmware_sum' clean step

Firmware update using 'update_firmware_sum' clean step fails with
an error stating that unable to connect to iLO address due to
authentication failure.
The 'update_firmware_sum' is an inband clean step wherein the
firmware ISO was inserted from IPA ramdisk. As part of security
fix to ironic the BMC credentials are no more passed to the IPA
ramdisk. The attempt to connect to iLO from IPA ramdisk fails.
The fix has been made to insert the firmware ISO from the
conductor.

Change-Id: I866330c5fc98b1c5bc042c296c3b6e76ed9fd57d
Story: 2006223
Task: 35821
(cherry picked from commit 50bfd9067fdeebcc89117ddab4fdd1573dba565e)

See `story 2006223 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006223>`__ for details.

commit_message:
Make puppet-tripleo compatible with latest puppet-rabbitmq

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677082/ merged today and moved puppet-rabbitmq to 9.1.0
which is breaking our spec tests:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/e767db93fe214514bebc065a64288548/log/job-output.txt

So we error out with things like:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527187 | centos-7 | 1) tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq on redhat-7-x86_64 behaves like tripleo::certmonger::rabbitmq should include the base for using certmonger
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527435 | centos-7 | Failure/Error: include ::rabbitmq::params
2019-08-19 07:19:37.527713 | centos-7 | Puppet::PreformattedError:
2019-08-19 07:19:37.528769 | centos-7 | Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, Could not find class ::rabbitmq::params for centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916 (file: /home/zuul/workspace/spec/fixtures/modules/tripleo/manifests/certmonger/rabbitmq.pp, line: 51, column: 3) on node centos-7-rax-ord-0010255916

Let's remove any reference to rabbitmq::params and also the following
two notifies:
  File[$service_certificate] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>
  File[$service_key] ~> Service<| title == $::rabbitmq::service_name |>

They do nothing in a containerized deployment anyway.

Tested as follows:
- Full downstream OSP15 HA deploy

Change-Id: Ib7c373c10ff7bcd8ec33cb912a8a0a4a32a196e2
Closes-Bug: #1840641

commit_message:
Move dnsmasq restarts to privsep.

I don't really love this one, but I don't see a better way to
untangle this.

Change-Id: Icce18320a7c8fba3cf06bd032fbbe1846804e897
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/639280/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @nova.privsep.sys_admin_pctxt.entrypoint def restart_dnsmasq(flag_file, network_ref, config_file, pid_path, opts_path, dhcp_lease_time, lease_max, conf_path, dhcp_bridge, dhcp_domain, dns_servers, hosts_path): _restart_dnsmasq_inner(flag_file, network_ref, config_file, pid_path, opts_path, dhcp_lease_time, lease_max, conf_path, dhcp_bridge, dhcp_domain, dns_servers, hosts_path) # NOTE(mikal): this is done like this to enable unit testing def _restart_dnsmasq_inner(flag_file, network_ref, config_file, pid_path, opts_path, dhcp_lease_time, lease_max, conf_path, dhcp_bridge, dhcp_domain, dns_servers, hosts_path): cmd = ['env', 'CONFIG_FILE=%s' % flag_file, 'NETWORK_ID=%s' % str(network_ref['id']), 'dnsmasq', '--strict-order', '--bind-interfaces', '--conf-file=%s' % config_file, '--pid-file=%s' % pid_path, '--dhcp-optsfile=%s' % opts_path, '--listen-address=%s' % network_ref['dhcp_server'], '--except-interface=lo', '--dhcp-range=set:%s,%s,static,%s,%ss' % (network_ref['label'], network_ref['dhcp_start'], network_ref['netmask'], dhcp_lease_time), '--dhcp-lease-max=%s' % lease_max, '--dhcp-hostsfile=%s' % conf_path, '--dhcp-script=%s' % dhcp_bridge, '--no-hosts', '--leasefile-ro'] # dnsmasq currently gives an error for an empty domain, # rather than ignoring. So only specify it if defined. if dhcp_domain: cmd.append('--domain=%s' % dhcp_domain) if dns_servers: cmd.append('--no-resolv') for dns_server in dns_servers: cmd.append('--server=%s' % dns_server) if network_ref['multi_host']: cmd.append('--addn-hosts=%s' % hosts_path) processutils.execute(*cmd)

commit_message:
Move iptables rule fetching and setting to privsep.

Rules are fetched, edited, and set. Keep the edit logic in nova/network,
but move the bits requiring elevated permissions to privsep.

Change-Id: I1f8382c450b95d261f68ec8bae2a2077f9361fe0

commit_message:
Ansible SIG

This patch proposes the addition of an Ansible SIG within the
OpenStack community.

Change-Id: Ibfa0d5362cdb24753413ac2c35f6e2fdbbf5ab01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance-sigs refs/changes/28/676428/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ansible: chairs: - name: Mohammed Naser irc: mnaser email: mnaser@vexxhost.com - name: Kevin Carter irc: cloudnull email: kecarter@redhat.com scope: > Ansible is an orchestration tool that is becoming increasingly common in usage across many parts of OpenStack. There are a few deployment projects that are using it, alongside many of our CI systems. This SIG exists to help create a colloborative space between different interested parties to share Ansible code under one group. status: active url: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ansible-sig

subject: Fix use of mock.patch with new_callable=PropertyMock
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 17:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/27f6579fa9a1797d82639eaf0c2361e2b30c39b7', 'message': "Fix use of mock.patch with new_callable=PropertyMock

mock.patch's new_callable attribute is supposed to be set to a
callable object which when called will generate the new object for the
patched object to return:

  https://docs.python.org/dev/library/unittest.mock.html#unittest.mock.patch

So when it is desired to return a PropertyMock object, new_callable
should be set to the class, not an instance of the class.

Alternatively if it is desired to set the return value within the
decorator, then the new attribute should be used instead of
new_callable.

So change existing tests to adhere to this principle.  Previously they
passed more or less by accident, due to instances of PropertyMock
themselves being callable even though they are supposed to be used as
properties rather than methods.

Change-Id: I707169384c5732b9ad9f3941a9334f96478d4aab
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use of mock.patch with new_callable=PropertyMock

mock.patch's new_callable attribute is supposed to be set to a
callable object which when called will generate the new object for the
patched object to return:

  https://docs.python.org/dev/library/unittest.mock.html#unittest.mock.patch

So when it is desired to return a PropertyMock object, new_callable
should be set to the class, not an instance of the class.

Alternatively if it is desired to set the return value within the
decorator, then the new attribute should be used instead of
new_callable.

So change existing tests to adhere to this principle.  Previously they
passed more or less by accident, due to instances of PropertyMock
themselves being callable even though they are supposed to be used as
properties rather than methods.

Change-Id: I707169384c5732b9ad9f3941a9334f96478d4aab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/676738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: new_callable=mock.PropertyMock) mock_image_meta.return_value = mock.sentinel.image_meta mock.sentinel.image_meta, vif_direct)

subject: devstack: Fix libvirtd/libvirt-bin detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-16 20:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/c6b5ebf35fa993497c35d0f598578b33a58911da', 'message': 'devstack: Fix libvirtd/libvirt-bin detection

Attempting to devstack on bionic failed with:

Failed to restart libvirt-bin.service: Unit libvirt-bin.service not found.

devstack/lib/ironic was trying to figure out whether our libvirtd
service is called libvirtd or libvirt-bin based on:
- Are we on ubuntu?
- Does /etc/init.d/libvirtd not exist?

 if is_ubuntu && [ ! -f /etc/init.d/libvirtd ]; then
     libvirt_service_name="libvirt-bin"

But on this bionic, for whatever reason, my libvirtd is at
/usr/sbin/libvirtd.

However, `type libvirtd` succeeds in either case.

So this commit broadens the second part of that check accordingly.

Note, FWIW, that devstack's lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt checks
this way:

 # Only Xenial is left with libvirt-bin.  Everywhere else is libvirtd
 if is_ubuntu && [ ${DISTRO} == "xenial" ]; then
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirt-bin
 else
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirtd
 fi

Change-Id: I94a86a96d5732db60c12399fcaf666f960461e3e
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: Fix libvirtd/libvirt-bin detection

Attempting to devstack on bionic failed with:

Failed to restart libvirt-bin.service: Unit libvirt-bin.service not found.

devstack/lib/ironic was trying to figure out whether our libvirtd
service is called libvirtd or libvirt-bin based on:
- Are we on ubuntu?
- Does /etc/init.d/libvirtd not exist?

 if is_ubuntu && [ ! -f /etc/init.d/libvirtd ]; then
     libvirt_service_name="libvirt-bin"

But on this bionic, for whatever reason, my libvirtd is at
/usr/sbin/libvirtd.

However, `type libvirtd` succeeds in either case.

So this commit broadens the second part of that check accordingly.

Note, FWIW, that devstack's lib/nova_plugins/functions-libvirt checks
this way:

 # Only Xenial is left with libvirt-bin.  Everywhere else is libvirtd
 if is_ubuntu && [ ${DISTRO} == "xenial" ]; then
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirt-bin
 else
     LIBVIRT_DAEMON=libvirtd
 fi

Change-Id: I94a86a96d5732db60c12399fcaf666f960461e3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/25/677025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_ubuntu && ! type libvirtd; then

commit_message:
Set keystone audit driver to stdout

This change sets the audit notification driver to log, which will
cause keystone to output any CADF/Basic audit notifications to
stdout.

Also removed the dependency on keystone-api for rabbitmq, as keystone
does not need an instance of rabbitmq outside of emitting notifications,
even then it will simply not emit a notification if rabbit is set
as the driver and not present.

Change-Id: I3a59a24d2f8479ce2875d0ddf33eb5e5c57dca7c

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright 2017 The Openstack-Helm Authors. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. set -xe #NOTE: Lint and package chart make keystone tee /tmp/keystone-rabbit.yaml <<EOF images: tags: rabbit_init: docker.io/rabbitmq:3.7-management dependencies: static: api: jobs: - keystone-rabbit-init rabbit_init: services: - service: oslo_messaging endpoint: internal db_sync: jobs: - keystone-rabbit-init pod: resources: jobs: rabbit_init: requests: memory: "128Mi" cpu: "100m" limits: memory: "1024Mi" cpu: "2000m" conf: keystone: oslo_messaging_notifications: driver: messagingv2 oslo_messaging_rabbit: rabbit_ha_queues: true manifests: job_rabbit_init: true secret_rabbitmq: true EOF #NOTE: Deploy command : ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS:=""} helm upgrade --install keystone ./keystone \ --namespace=openstack \ --values=/tmp/keystone-rabbit.yaml \ ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS} \ ${OSH_EXTRA_HELM_ARGS_KEYSTONE} #NOTE: Wait for deploy ./tools/deployment/common/wait-for-pods.sh openstack #NOTE: Validate Deployment info helm status keystone export OS_CLOUD=openstack_helm sleep 30 #NOTE(portdirect): Wait for ingress controller to update rules and restart Nginx openstack endpoint list

commit_message:
WIP - Add federated keystone chart

This change seeks to add a second keystone chart which will
have default settings to act as the service provider for K2K[0].

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/federation/configure_federation.html

Change-Id: Ib1ad0fb691f8006d6b7206a05de6cc327a06fe4c

commit_message:
runner: do not run exec if container not running

When running "podman exec", paunch was only trying to get the container
name from a "podman ps -a" and then run the exec.
It can be problematic if the container isn't running for some reasons.

We should first make sure the container is actually started and then
run the exec.

This patch does:

1) Introduce container_running() which use podman ps stdout to figure if
   whether or not the container is actually running.

2) In the running, if the action is "exec", we expect the container to
   be running so we call container_running and if the result is
   negative, we raise.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
rhbz#1739224
Co-Authored-By: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: David Peacock <dpeacock@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I4bd7d7e238f4d6405c92ac864618a7c34830fd01

commit_message:
runner: do not run exec if container not running

Use "podman" inspect to check if whether or not the container is
running before doing "podman exec"; and raise if not running.

It re-uses what was done for "podman run", where we run the "podman
inspect" by moving a block our of the conditions to always give the
container state for each container in the loop, and send a warning if
the state can't be found.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
rhbz#1739224

Change-Id: I68f806981f3f52890be5d4d73ef5f67868be4ab5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/paunch refs/changes/37/675637/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if container in desired_names: discover_container = self.runner.discover_container_name( container, self.config_id) inspect_container = self.runner.inspect(discover_container) try: self.log.debug("Container running state for %s: %s." % (container, inspect_container["State"]["Running"])) except Exception: self.log.warn("Unable to find the container state" + " for %s." % container) if action == 'run': if container in desired_names: if container in desired_names: if not inspect_container["State"]["Running"]: raise SystemError("Container %s is not running." % container)
deleted_lines: if action == 'run': if container in desired_names: discover_container = self.runner.discover_container_name( container, self.config_id) inspect_container = self.runner.inspect(discover_container) try: self.log.debug("Container running state for %s: %s." % (container, inspect_container["State"]["Running"])) except Exception: self.log.warn("Unable to find the container state" + " for %s." % container)

commit_message:
runner: do not run exec if container not running

Use "podman" inspect to check if whether or not the container is
running before doing "podman exec"; and raise if not running.

It re-uses what was done for "podman run", where we run the "podman
inspect" by moving a block our of the conditions to always give the
container state for each container in the loop, and send a warning if
the state can't be found.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
rhbz#1739224

Change-Id: I68f806981f3f52890be5d4d73ef5f67868be4ab5
(cherry picked from commit b2f055f234966729aec274d26932ba8df7091d9b)

deleted_lines: if action == 'run': if container in desired_names: discover_container = self.runner.discover_container_name( container, self.config_id) inspect_container = self.runner.inspect(discover_container) try: self.log.debug("Container running state for %s: %s." % (container, inspect_container["State"]["Running"])) except Exception: self.log.warn("Unable to find the container state" + " for %s." % container)

commit_message:
New neutron-lib release

It was discussed on today's Neutron team meeting [1] that as soon
as patch [2] will be merged we would like to release new version of
neutron-lib.
As [2] is merged now, we can release new version.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2019/
    networking.2019-08-13-14.00.log.html#l-154
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670849/

Change-Id: If803cac6f2e5f94cf71d93e63ad4a6272a8aacfd

commit_message:
sync: add service_setup.yml

Since we're using service_setup.yml in most part of the services,
it's time we started synchronizing this file across repos to
reduce it's maintenance costs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676996
Change-Id: I5796025f542e855e9adadf58ba67157aeec6e213

subject: qemu-img run slowly without proper permission
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-08 02:40:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/privsep/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/384eb5ef16d9605c6a782c31f926d3f12cbd48bc', 'message': 'qemu-img run slowly without proper permission

qemu-img run slowly without proper permission.
Without CAP_SYS_RAWIO, qemu-img will run slowly in nvme
when converting image(instance snapshot, nova file backend,
glance rbd backend)
Add CAP_SYS_RAWIO permission will improve the performance.

Change-Id: I67e9f0e8598c868fbaebac61a3223a90dfd519fe
Closes-Bug: #1839401
'}]
commit_message:
qemu-img run slowly without proper permission

qemu-img run slowly without proper permission.
Without CAP_SYS_RAWIO, qemu-img will run slowly in nvme
when converting image(instance snapshot, nova file backend,
glance rbd backend)
Add CAP_SYS_RAWIO permission will improve the performance.

Change-Id: I67e9f0e8598c868fbaebac61a3223a90dfd519fe
Closes-Bug: #1839401
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/675241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: capabilities.CAP_SYS_RAWIO,

commit_message:
Make functional jobs using py3

Make networking-odl-functional-oxygen and
networking-odl-functional-fluorine run on python3.

Change-Id: I10db3feaa32b51211cd770d2bcc4f9ba0f7defc3

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: Id9f6ff405ba49ce8a786f8b2f1b82bc54aaa3a93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-octavia refs/changes/95/676795/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-04 19:55:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6e535cf68cfca217e6f459ef498f5e575da8e960', 'message': "POC: tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

NOTE: the current released version of mock does not support all of these,
thus, an unreleased version of mock is used for this POC.

Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e

"}, {'number': 24, 'created': '2018-01-28 22:26:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f0a5531cf5b27b578c5f933fd468dd7615732ac7', 'message': "tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

There are a few cases in which a method / function cannot be autospeced
properly (builtin functions like open, print). In these cases, we're
passing in autospec=False.

One specific example in which mock autospec doesn't work properly is for
sqlalchemy table methods. For example, the insert function [1] has a
required argument which is injected by the method's decorator. Autospecing
that method won't replicate the decorator's behaviour in any way, causing
the method signature validation to fail, as it expects at least an argument
to be passed in.

[1] https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/master/lib/sqlalchemy/sql/selectable.py#L1743

Partial-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e

There are a few cases in which a method / function cannot be autospeced

Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and functions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

There are a few cases in which a method / function cannot be autospeced
properly (builtin functions like open, print). In these cases, we're
passing in autospec=False.

One specific example in which mock autospec doesn't work properly is for
sqlalchemy table methods. For example, the insert function [1] has a
required argument which is injected by the method's decorator. Autospecing
that method won't replicate the decorator's behaviour in any way, causing
the method signature validation to fail, as it expects at least an argument
to be passed in.

[1] https://github.com/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/blob/master/lib/sqlalchemy/sql/selectable.py#L1743

Partial-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e

commit_message:
Tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and functions.

oslotest.mock_fixture.patch_mock_module fixes a few issues within
mock.patch functions, as well as setting autospec=True by default,
unless otherwise specified or new_callable, create, spec arguments
are passed in.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Change-Id: I4484e63c97bd1cdde3d88855eabe7545784f365e
Closes-Bug: #1735588
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/75/470775/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mock_fixedip_disassociate.assert_called_once_with()

subject: Convert filter_metadata_diff result to list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-02 11:48:14.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/tests/functional/db/test_migrations.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/c03dc0dd6ec9165a06bf1592d62d5f68dfe1b799', 'message': 'Convert filter_metadata_diff result to list

filter_metadata_diff method gives a way to whitelist/blacklist
differences between migration scripts and db models, for the
test_models_sync test.
The test fails on python3 because filter builtin on python3 returns
iterable instead of a list.
Fix this problem by returning always a list.

Change-Id: I7dfc3adf52131211dd3b9e180c82370d39779541
'}]
commit_message:
Convert filter_metadata_diff result to list

filter_metadata_diff method gives a way to whitelist/blacklist
differences between migration scripts and db models, for the
test_models_sync test.
The test fails on python3 because filter builtin on python3 returns
iterable instead of a list.
Fix this problem by returning always a list.

Change-Id: I7dfc3adf52131211dd3b9e180c82370d39779541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/60/668660/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return list(filter(self._filter_mysql_server_func_now, diff))

subject: Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-19 04:16:40.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/placement/placement-api-container-puppet.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/d8794bd9e6938ae549e3a3abef01f5dba89bf249', 'message': "Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script

The script mysql-migrate-db.sh [1] is driven entirely by environment
variables, and only does direct database operations, so there is no
need for a configured /etc/nova to exist within the container which
runs it.

This change removes the unused bind mount to
/var/lib/config-data/nova/etc/nova/. This directory doesn't exist when
nova isn't deployed, so this change allows placement to be deployed
without nova (which is a valid use-case).

Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/branch/master/placement_db_tools/mysql-migrate-db.sh

Change-Id: I3d506944970a61354b7e8c034ea897d64660bfaa

commit_message:
Don't mount /etc/nova into placement migrate script

The script mysql-migrate-db.sh [1] is driven entirely by environment
variables, and only does direct database operations, so there is no
need for a configured /etc/nova to exist within the container which
runs it.

This change removes the unused bind mount to
/var/lib/config-data/nova/etc/nova/. This directory doesn't exist when
nova isn't deployed, so this change allows placement to be deployed
without nova (which is a valid use-case).

Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/src/branch/master/placement_db_tools/mysql-migrate-db.sh

Change-Id: I3d506944970a61354b7e8c034ea897d64660bfaa

commit_message:
Add local development with FreeIPA focused featureset043

In order to deploy FreeIPA on the supplemental node using libvirt
for testing, you have historically needed to carry custom patches
to feature set 39 or manually hand in overrides at the cli while
invoking quickstart.sh.

Feature set 43 is derives from feature set 39. It has slight
variations to networking which allow for deploying supplemental node
(and other security features) using the libvirt/setup/supplemental
role.

Change-Id: Ib3fc1ef0b9065542a8995d70536252dc0b3af0ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/98/674398/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Summary of feature set # Deploy an HA OpenStack environment with FreeIPA as an IdM. # Note that this feature set derives from featureset039 and is meant for use # in local development using the libvirt/setup/supplemental/ roles. It is not # tested or meant to run in upstream or 3rd party CI. # This enables TLS for the undercloud which will also make haproxy bind to the # configured public-vip and admin-vip. undercloud_generate_service_certificate: true ssl_overcloud: true overcloud_templates_path: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates undercloud_templates_path: /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates step_introspect: true # This enables container deployements after Pike containerized_overcloud: >- {% if release in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%} false {%- else -%} true {%- endif -%} delete_docker_cache: true containerized_undercloud: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike','queens'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} ctlplane_masquerade: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike','queens'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} undercloud_enable_routed_networks: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} undercloud_clean_nodes: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} undercloud_inspection_extras: false # Tell tripleo about our environment. enable_pacemaker: true network_isolation: true network_isolation_type: "single-nic-vlans" # This featureset is extremely resource intensive, so we disable telemetry # in order to reduce the overall memory footprint # This is not required in newton telemetry_args: >- {% if release != 'newton' %} -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/environments/disable-telemetry.yaml {% endif %} extra_args: >- {% if release not in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] %} -e {{ overcloud_templates_path }}/ci/environments/ovb-ha.yaml {% endif %} undercloud_ntp_servers: pool.ntp.org # keep the doc gen settings at the bottom of the config file. # options below direct automatic doc generation by tripleo-collect-logs artcl_gen_docs: true artcl_create_docs_payload: included_deployment_scripts: - undercloud-install - novajoin_prep - install_novajoin - overcloud-custom-tht-script - "{% if release not in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%}overcloud-prep-containers{%- endif -%}" - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate - "{% if run_tempest|bool -%}tempest-setup{%- endif -%}" - "{% if run_tempest|bool and tempest_format|default('packages') == 'containers' -%}tempest_container{%- endif -%}" included_static_docs: - env-setup-virt table_of_contents: - env-setup-virt - novajoin_prep - install_novajoin - undercloud-install - overcloud-custom-tht-script - "{% if release not in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%}overcloud-prep-containers{%- endif -%}" - overcloud-prep-flavors - overcloud-prep-images - overcloud-prep-network - overcloud-deploy - overcloud-deploy-post - overcloud-validate - "{% if run_tempest|bool -%}tempest-setup{%- endif -%}" - "{% if run_tempest|bool and tempest_format|default('packages') == 'containers' -%}tempest_container{%- endif -%}" deploy_steps_ansible_workflow: >- {% if release not in ['newton','ocata','pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} config_download_args: >- {% if release in ['queens'] -%} -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/config-download-environment.yaml --config-download --verbose {%- endif -%} # Tempest configuration, keep always at the end of the file # Use the traditional ping test in newton, ocata and pike # Run tempest in queens+ test_ping: >- {% if release in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} run_tempest: >- {% if release in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike'] -%} false {%- else -%} true {%- endif -%} test_white_regex: '' tempest_whitelist: - 'tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps.test_network_basic_ops' tempest_format: >- {% if containerized_undercloud|bool -%} container {%- else -%} packages {%- endif -%} undercloud_enable_tempest: >- {% if release not in ['newton', 'ocata', 'pike', 'queens'] -%} true {%- else -%} false {%- endif -%} undercloud_container_cli: >- {% if release in ['rocky'] -%} docker {%- else -%} podman {%- endif -%} # TLS everywhere related vars. # enable_tls_everywhere: true novajoin_connect_timeout: 60 novajoin_read_timeout: 60 freeipa_admin_password: fce95318204114530f31f885c9df588f # Set node hostnames. freeipa_internal_ip: "{{ external_network_cidr|nthhost(250) }}" supplemental_node_ip: "{{ freeipa_internal_ip }}" undercloud_undercloud_nameservers: ["{{ freeipa_internal_ip }}"] overcloud_dns_servers: ["{{ freeipa_internal_ip }}", "8.8.8.8"] tripleo_domain: ooo.test undercloud_cloud_domain: "{{ tripleo_domain }}" freeipa_server_hostname: "ipa.{{ tripleo_domain }}" undercloud_undercloud_hostname: "undercloud.{{ tripleo_domain }}" overcloud_cloud_name: "overcloud.{{ tripleo_domain }}" overcloud_cloud_domain: "{{ tripleo_domain }}" overcloud_cloud_name_internal: "overcloud.internalapi.{{ tripleo_domain }}" overcloud_cloud_name_storage: "overcloud.storage.{{ tripleo_domain }}" overcloud_cloud_name_storage_management: "overcloud.storagemgmt.{{ tripleo_domain }}" overcloud_cloud_name_ctlplane: "overcloud.ctlplane.{{ tripleo_domain }}" # Supplemental node related vars. # # Ensure that the FreeIPA server node is provisioned during deployment. deploy_supplemental_node: true supplemental_user: centos supplemental_image_url: https://cloud.centos.org/centos/7/images/CentOS-7-x86_64-GenericCloud.qcow2 undercloud_custom_env_files: "{{ working_dir }}/undercloud-parameter-defaults.yaml" undercloud_resource_registry_args: "OS::TripleO::Undercloud::Net::SoftwareConfig": "{{ undercloud_templates_path }}/net-config-undercloud.yaml"

commit_message:
Update supplemental role to paramaterize networking

Maintaining a simple parameter rather than a hardcoded IP
is desired behavior.

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: Ie196f329f2f5b98960c895e2bfcf0ea8082ee2b4

documentation can deep-link to it.

commit_message:
Fix : sort variables fetched from env list

In bionic, when exporting env variables, the env list displays
variables in unsorted format.
While fetching we are getting 'https_proxy' before 'http_proxy'
which is failing in comparison to our expected values[1].
This patch sorts the variables fetched from env.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/30/643130/3/check/devstack-unit-tests/effbf7a/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-13_23_12_35_465026

Change-Id: Ie504eabf0d3fec1b97bc711e2702c06bcf75d158
(cherry picked from commit deadc7c439f1126ba986b9c4f3c4d0b6d7774016)

commit_message:
add psycopg2-binary

This patch adds psycopg2-binary which is a binary version of
psycopg2 which will install much quicker for testing purposes
and make it easier for users to test locally without needing
compilers and headers to run tests.

Change-Id: Ic765931f7362a1be970c4a2b6ff3b7051384b321

commit_message:
Add cross-nova-py37 job

A recent commit [1] started causing failures on py37 (see the related
bug). This could have been avoided by having at least one py37
check/gate job running on requirements changes, so this commit adds one.

Related-Bug: #1840551

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675816/

Change-Id: I4be10c36e7ef64028cb5646a9e455a2eb1710b1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/71/677071/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix 'has_calls' method calls in unit tests

The 'has_calls' method does not exist in assertion methods of mock.
Replace the 'has_calls' method with an 'assert_has_calls' method or
an 'assert_called_once_with' method.
Add an 'assertEqual' check before an 'assert_has_calls' method.

Change-Id: I4b606fce473d064b9bb00213696c075cea020aaf
Closes-Bug: #1840200

commit_message:
Do not use a role scoped variable for role include condition

The var tempest_plugin_install_source is defined within the
os_tempest role so if it is used in the condition that includes
the python_venv_build role, it must be in scope for the python venv
build handler which runs in the outer containing playbook, and
this fails with a var not found error.

Change-Id: I7d1fd3b7d06d3a0c6d86750ed36cbe858190f87e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/96/676996/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note(jrosser) this task can be conditional on tempest_plugin_install_source # but then that variable must be in scope when the handler inside python_venv_build # runs, so it is better to duplicate the underlying condition logic # when: not tempest_plugin_install_source when: not "{{ ((tempest_install_method == 'distro') and (ansible_os_family | lower == 'debian')) | bool }}"

commit_message:
Add ceph/ceph-ansible to untrusted github projects

Kolla-ansible plans to integrate with ceph-ansible
(kolla ceph deployment has been deprecated in Train [0])

Adding this will allow using ceph-ansible project in
required-projects for ceph-ansible related CI jobs.

[0]: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/reference/storage/ceph-guide.html

Change-Id: I725566c1b6eb6bf9ea663ce3e20d7e7237b7cea8

commit_message:
Freeze LOCI images with a date

In the last patch to freeze images with a date, the LOCI images
were not added, do to the length of the patch [1].

This patch fixes the absence of LOCI based frozen image by
changing the CI appropriately, in the same way as the previous
patch ([1]).

However, LOCI configuration here was most of the time relying
on inheritance, which made bugs hard to find. This cleans up
the LOCI building by:
1) Having a common abstract profile for which all the main
   zuul variables are inherited
2) Making sure each branch has content without inheritance,
   but with only limited repetitions. This uses anchors
   to reduce the information to type about _projects, as
   the project details are most likely the same as master.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663744

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676398
Change-Id: I6f33d5b7a33904cdd1c5ec352046ca9a9bca2aba

commit_message:
Add support for Nautilus release

Resync charms.ceph to pickup changes to support new approach to
admin and bootstrap key generation with in the ceph-mon cluster.

Update get_mon_hosts to avoid specifying the port number for the
MON daemons; we use the default so this is not required, and at
Nautilus the MON daemons run both v1 and v2 messenger ports.

Specifying the port in the ceph.conf file disables the v2
messenger port which is not the desired behaviour on upgrade
or new installation.

Drop start hook; this has been present in the charm since its
inception as 'ceph' but is really not needed - re-deploying the
charm to units which previous hosted ceph-mon is dangerous
and the ceph-* daemons should still be running anyway.

Depends-On: I2dfab7404b72e314625ea554ee64595c5e26f3c6
Change-Id: I340dbf427551e6f9f8cd4ca89128627e497d6097

added_lines: write_file,_client_admin_keyring = '/etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring' return os.path.exists(_client_admin_keyring) _create_monitor(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker) _create_keyrings()def _create_monitor(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker): @retry_on_exception(3, base_delay=5) def _create_keyrings(): if cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '14.0.0') >= 0: # NOTE(jamespage): At Nautilus, keys are created by the # monitors and just need exporting. output = str(subprocess.check_output( [ 'sudo', '-u', ceph_user(), 'ceph', '--name', 'mon.', '--keyring', '/var/lib/ceph/mon/ceph-{}/keyring'.format( socket.gethostname() ), 'auth', 'get', 'client.admin', ]).decode('UTF-8')).strip() if not output: # NOTE: key not yet created, raise exception and retry raise Exception write_file(_client_admin_keyring, output, owner=ceph_user(), group=ceph_user(), perms=0o400) else: # NOTE(jamespage): Later ceph releases require explicit # call to ceph-create-keys to setup the # admin keys for the cluster; this command # will wait for quorum in the cluster before # returning. # NOTE(fnordahl): Explicitly run `ceph-crate-keys` for older # ceph releases too. This improves bootstrap # resilience as the charm will wait for # presence of peer units before attempting # to bootstrap. Note that charms deploying # ceph-mon service should disable running of # `ceph-create-keys` service in init system. cmd = ['ceph-create-keys', '--id', hostname] if cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '12.0.0') >= 0: # NOTE(fnordahl): The default timeout in ceph-create-keys of 600 # seconds is not adequate. Increase timeout when # timeout parameter available. For older releases # we rely on retry_on_exception decorator. # LP#1719436 cmd.extend(['--timeout', '1800']) subprocess.check_call(cmd) osstat = os.stat(_client_admin_keyring) if not osstat.st_size: # NOTE(fnordahl): Retry will fail as long as this file exists. # LP#1719436 os.remove(_client_admin_keyring) raise Exception
deleted_lines: return os.path.exists(_bootstrap_keyring) add_keyring_to_ceph(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker) @retry_on_exception(3, base_delay=5) def add_keyring_to_ceph(keyring, secret, hostname, path, done, init_marker): # NOTE(jamespage): Later ceph releases require explicit # call to ceph-create-keys to setup the # admin keys for the cluster; this command # will wait for quorum in the cluster before # returning. # NOTE(fnordahl): Explicitly run `ceph-crate-keys` for older # ceph releases too. This improves bootstrap # resilience as the charm will wait for # presence of peer units before attempting # to bootstrap. Note that charms deploying # ceph-mon service should disable running of # `ceph-create-keys` service in init system. cmd = ['ceph-create-keys', '--id', hostname] if cmp_pkgrevno('ceph', '12.0.0') >= 0: # NOTE(fnordahl): The default timeout in ceph-create-keys of 600 # seconds is not adequate. Increase timeout when # timeout parameter available. For older releases # we rely on retry_on_exception decorator. # LP#1719436 cmd.extend(['--timeout', '1800']) subprocess.check_call(cmd) _client_admin_keyring = '/etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring' osstat = os.stat(_client_admin_keyring) if not osstat.st_size: # NOTE(fnordahl): Retry will fail as long as this file exists. # LP#1719436 os.remove(_client_admin_keyring) raise Exception

commit_message:
Add 'node' attribute to baremetal Allocation

This attribute is only used for create_allocation. When it is
specified, an allocation is created for an existing active node
without going through the normal allocation steps.

Change-Id: Ia0e54d7a38bdc50b163113c6435d49b33ced947d

commit_message:
Add molecule tests for the undercloud-cpu role

Change-Id: I1951ea46bd426b55157d6b1b863fd8a46c110755
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5f0e39a7febd3fc5bc7bb0b20250d4280652bc6b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/00/677200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Molecule managed # Copyright 2019 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. {% if item.registry is defined %} FROM {{ item.registry.url }}/{{ item.image }} {% else %} FROM {{ item.image }} {% endif %} RUN if [ $(command -v apt-get) ]; then apt-get update && apt-get install -y python sudo bash ca-certificates && apt-get clean; \ elif [ $(command -v dnf) ]; then dnf makecache && dnf --assumeyes install python sudo python-devel python*-dnf bash {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && dnf clean all; \ elif [ $(command -v yum) ]; then yum makecache fast && yum install -y python sudo yum-plugin-ovl python-setuptools bash {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && sed -i 's/plugins=0/plugins=1/g' /etc/yum.conf && yum clean all; \ elif [ $(command -v zypper) ]; then zypper refresh && zypper install -y python sudo bash python-xml {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && zypper clean -a; \ elif [ $(command -v apk) ]; then apk update && apk add --no-cache python sudo bash ca-certificates {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }}; \ elif [ $(command -v xbps-install) ]; then xbps-install -Syu && xbps-install -y python sudo bash ca-certificates {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && xbps-remove -O; fi {% for pkg in item.easy_install | default([]) %} # install pip for centos where there is no python-pip rpm in default repos RUN easy_install {{ pkg }} {% endfor %} CMD ["sh", "-c", "while true; do sleep 10000; done"]

commit_message:
Add exception message when user 'Create  Application Credential'

When User tries to 'Create  Application Credential' with a
past/old date, User get an error message
"Unable to create application credential" on horizon
but IMO we need to raise an error message like keystone
"The 'expires_at' date must not be before now". This patch corrects
the error message.

Change-Id: I16e1a6c1bee39aa16b4f1507291f782b0bb80be7
Closes-Bug: #1838606
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/45/673945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except Exception as ex: exceptions.handle( request, _('Unable to create application credential: %s') % ex)
deleted_lines: except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _('Unable to create application credential.'))

commit_message:
Add option "--split" to command "ironic node-list"

Makes output of the above command readable, by splitting all the
nodes' data into separate smaller tables (one table per node).

Change-Id: I32cd07382d5618e12580e15e4a3af5f726f71ebf
Closes-Bug: #1528497

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: I8ab5b1fac042a5ea5a8dcd3db7c9912ad58b67ee

commit_message:
Update series metadata

Ensure that EOL releases are removed from metadata
and tests, and that the current dev release is enabled
in metadata.  Dev release tests are enabled separately
because of chickens and eggs.

Change-Id: I2a595e9e6a580178634b70f69e13d91af838afbd

commit_message:
Fix 'X-Subject-Token' format which should without dashed

[1] is wrong amendment which had change the X-Subject-Token format.
Since [2] had been merged, this patch fix the format without dashed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399453/1/ironicclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398788

Change-Id: I2e98b43f7a070b137c1aa7239c5b987fcd138057

commit_message:
Tests for testing node-create command

Tests for the Ironic CLI commands which check actions with node-create
command.

Closes-Bug: #1529683
Co-Authored-By: Kyrylo Romanenko <kromanenko@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I8f4f96e57804b36ccc757bc71476d066288a9a42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/55/262055/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from ironicclient.tests.functional import base import ironicclient.tests.functional.utils as utils import ast class NodeCreateTestsIronicClient(base.FunctionalTestBase): """Tests for testing node-create command. Tests for the Ironic CLI commands which checks actions with node-create command. """ def _assertEqualKeyValuePair(self, key_value_pair, node_object): """Assert that key/value pair equals node key/value pair. :param key_value_pair: key/value pair :type key_value_pair: string :param node_object: node object like driver-info, properties, or extra :type node_object: string """ key_value_pair = dict(x.split('=') for x in key_value_pair.split(' ')) node_object = ast.literal_eval(node_object) self.assertEqual(node_object, key_value_pair) def test_node_create_specific_name_n_key(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with specific name using -n key 2) check that node with specific name has been successfully created """ node_name = utils.generate_name() node = self.create_node(params='-n {0}'.format(node_name)) self.assertEqual(node['name'], node_name) def test_node_create_specific_name_name_key(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with specific name using --name key 2) check that node with specific name has been successfully created """ node_name = utils.generate_name() node = self.create_node(params='--name {0}'.format(node_name)) self.assertEqual(node['name'], node_name) def test_node_create_specific_uuid_u_key(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with specific uuid using -u key 2) check that node with specific uuid has been successfully created """ node_uuid = 'ffffffff-ffff-ffff-ffff-ffffffffffff' node = self.create_node(params='-u {0}'.format(node_uuid)) self.assertEqual(node['uuid'], node_uuid) def test_node_create_specific_uuid_uuid_key(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with specific uuid using --uuid key 2) check that node with specific uuid has been successfully created """ node_uuid = 'ffffffff-ffff-ffff-ffff-ffffffffffff' node = self.create_node(params='--uuid {0}'.format(node_uuid)) self.assertEqual(node['uuid'], node_uuid) def test_node_create_driver_info(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with specific driver info 2) check that node with specific driver info has been successfully created """ driver_info = 'kernel=True' node = self.create_node(params='-i {0}'.format(driver_info)) self._assertEqualKeyValuePair(driver_info, node['driver_info']) def test_node_create_driver_info_multiple(self): """Test steps: 1) create node using specific driver info multiple times 2) check that node with specific driver info has been successfully created """ driver_info = 'kernel=True time=enable power=VCC' node = self.create_node(params='-i {0}'.format(driver_info)) self._assertEqualKeyValuePair(driver_info, node['driver_info']) def test_node_create_properties(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with --properties key 2) check that node with --properties key has been successfully created """ pass def test_node_create_properties_multiple(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with --properties key 2) check that node with --properties key has been successfully created """ pass def test_node_create_extra(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with --extra key 2) check that node with --extra key has been successfully created """ pass def test_node_create_extra_multiple(self): """Test steps: 1) create node with --extra key 2) check that node with --extra key has been successfully created """ pass
